itemDescription: American lawyer and judge, signer of the US Declaration of Independence (1731-1814)

wikipedia_page.main: Robert Treat Paine (March 11, 1731 – May 11, 1814) was an American lawyer and politician, best known as a signer of the Declaration of Independence as a representative of Massachusetts. He served as the state's first attorney general, and served as an associate justice of the Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, the state's highest court. Paine was also a founding member of the Pennsylvania Abolition Society and had always opposed slavery.
